alert.note: Alert for Floyd; Hale; Lubbock (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Lubbock (Lubbock and South Plains Texas)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued June 02 at 4:12PM CDT until June 02 at 5:45PM CDT by NWS Lubbock
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 545 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON FOR SOUTHWESTERN FLOYD, HALE AND NORTHERN LUBBOCK COUNTIES... At 412 PM CDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated the strongest thunderstorms were moving out of the warned area. Up to 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. Some flash flooding is ongoing. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar and automated gauges. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Plainview, Abernathy, Hale Center, Petersburg, Cotton Center, Halfway, Seth Ward and New Deal. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR AND GAUGE INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
